department.dept_long_name: Division of Engineering and Applied Sciences

course.title: Decision Theory
course.description: Mathematical analysis of decision making. Bayesian inference and risk. Maximum likelihood and nonparametric methods. Algorithmic methods for decision rules: perceptrons, neural nets, and back propagation. Hidden Markov models, Blum-Welch, principal and independent components.
course.prerequisites: Applied Mathematics 21a,b or Mathematics 21a,b, and Statistics 110 or equivalents.
